result.title: Objective
result.description: To promote inter-sector approaches to BD conservation through the tourism and fisheries sectors

indicator.title: Indicator 1
indicator.description: Improvements in the conservation status of Objects of Conservation (OCs) in the coastal/marine zone, measured by proportions of OCs with different levels of conservation status (as defined by PDVSA/ INTECMAR/USB/TNC study)

baseline.comment:
Conservation status % of OCs
Threatened 29%
Moderate status 43%
Very good status 28%

target.comment:
Conservation status % of OCs
Threatened 6%
Moderate status 47%
Very good status 47%

actual.comment: The results obtained in Outcome 2, have helped to decrease the degree of threat of Protected Areas with the majority of Conservation Objectives (OC). This underpinned by the administrators of the areas who have updated management tools that allow them to optimize decision-making.

indicator.title: Indicator 2
indicator.description: Increase in the average total METT rating for protected areas in the project area

actual.comment:
In the first quarter of 2015, a total of 12 meetings were held with administrators of Protected Areas for the induction of this methodology. These meetings resulted in the definition of the strategy from the institutional point of view, for filling the METT tool by Protected Areas managers.
The results showed progress in the overall score, and specific discussions showed the need for further efforts in terms of personnel management, equipment, infrastructure, and detailed planning of areas and aspects related to budget and the financial management system.
For the workshop (with a duration of two days), a total of 20 people were involved. The updated METT shows as a result an increase in the total average of 7.19 points (improving the base value by 53.8%). The result of the current evaluation is 34.5/97.54, compared to the initial situation of 27.31/97.54.

result.title: Outcome 1
result.description: Enhanced institutional, legal and policy framework developed to efficiently manage Marine and Coastal Protected Areas (MCPA)

indicator.title: Indicator 1
indicator.description: Increase in METT scores related to management instruments (categories 1-4 – see ProDoc Annex 14 Section 2)

actual.comment: The updated METT shows a result of 3.51/12, which represents an increase in values of 48% from the base value calculated at the start of the project (2.63/12). This increase is sustained on improvements in the technical training of staff and the inclusion of a greater number of technical staff related to some of the areas evaluated.

indicator.title: Indicator 2
indicator.description: Availability of geographical information to key decision makers

baseline.comment:
Only basic cartographic information is included in the Simón Bolívar Geoportal
Simón Bolívar Geoportal has recently been established and is not yet fully operational

target.comment:
75 layers of key information for PA management, covering the project area, are available on line, of which 10 are continuously updated in real time
70 key institutional stakeholders (Directorates of Ministries, Universities) and 18 PA managers in INPARQUES have downloaded and used key information in previous 3 months

actual.comment: It has been obtained an advance of 50% in the definition of the key information levels which will feature the Information System for Management Planning (SIGOT for its acronyms in Spanish). Similarly, there is an index of information on Protected Areas with a total of 45 layers. Also, the cartographic information of each management instrument is being updated. A total of 6 meetings with key stakeholders and institutions and 14 Protected Areas supervisors were conducted to define the type of information to update. One out of the two visualization facilities is currently installed in a 100%. The other facility shows a progress of around 20%.

result.title: Outcome 2
result.description: PA managers have access to tools and instruments for the management, the design, and the declaration or expansion of PAs within the coastal/marine area

target.comment:
Corridor: 5,075,051 ha (1)
New PA: 2,060,297 ha (4)
PA Expansions: 1,719,153 ha (11)
Additional total 8,854,501 ha (5)
Cumulative Total 14,517,183 ha (54)

actual.comment:
In the reporting period they have been addressed a total of 19 Protected Areas, with a surface of approximately 1,206,709.49 ha. This implies a rise of 12.52% of the area established in the PRODOC. Progress was also made in the drafting of a document that addresses general criteria for connectivity between Protected Areas in the coastal marine area.
Regarding new Protected Areas, the project addressed a total of 7 new areas covering an approximate surface of 160,440 ha. With regard to the expansion of existing Protected Areas, the project addressed 3 areas, with a total surface of 152,525 ha. The strategy has been to cover smaller surface areas, and therefore more manageable, seeking the representativeness of priority ecosystems added to the existing system.
Given the fact that official publication of management instruments is outside the competence of the Ministry for Ecosocialism and Water, it is highlighted recent changes in the approval processes of this type of management tools. However, the addressed instruments have covered the process of public and institutional consultation established by law.

indicator.title: Indicator 2
indicator.description: Proportion of the 49 priority ABRAEs in the project area with management plans (PORUs)

actual.comment: A total of 8 out of 13 elaborations management instruments (PORU for its acronyms in Spanish) have been addresses. This advance represents the 62% towards the target. However, the project has exceeded the target in terms of surface by 105.9%, reaching a total of 528,771 ha, improving the goal by 390,180 ha.

indicator.title: Indicator 3
indicator.description: Proportion of the 24 priority ABRAEs in the project area with PORUs, whose PORUs are less than 20 years old

actual.comment: At the time, 6 out of 13 upgrades have been addressed. Regarding the goal surface (390,180 ha), these 6 PORU mean 94% of the target, getting to date a total of 364,973.55 ha.

indicator.title: Indicator 4
indicator.description: Proportion of ABRAEs in the project area with PORUs produced since 1990, which are being implemented

actual.comment: A total of 4 PORU selected for implementation have been approved by law. In this regard, the goal have been reached in a 100%.

indicator.title: Indicator 5
indicator.description: Total METT rating for PAs in relation to management tools and capacities (criteria 5-23 – see ProDoc Annex 14 Section 2)

actual.comment: The updated METT shows a value of 21,04/58, resulting in 54.28% of progress towards the goal (38.76/58). All management tools were taken into account improving the following indicators: area management implementation, management plans, resource inventory and staff training.

result.title: Outcome 3
result.description: The SMPA is supported by a sustainable financial system and increased revenues

indicator.title: Indicator 1
indicator.description: Government funding for PAs in the project area

baseline.comment: Estimated amount $1.5 million (22% of estimated needs), to be confirmed during process of financial analysis at project startup

target.comment: Estimated amount $2 million (30% above current level) to be confirmed during process of financial analysis at project startup

actual.comment: Diagnostics were made for 7 Protected Areas referred to the different types of income. As a result, there are guidelines to develop specific mechanisms for planning and financial management capacity assessment of supervisors according to available funds, and the proposed mechanisms for increasing diversification of revenues. These diagnostics, constitutes the base to formulate the financial plan for the Protected Areas System.

indicator.title: Indicator 2
indicator.description: Amount of funding for PAs in the project area from sources other than Government recurrent budget

baseline.comment: To be determined during process of financial analysis at project startup

actual.comment: It is planned to be determined in the extension period.

indicator.title: Indicator 3
indicator.description: Amount of funds generated by individual PAs

baseline.comment: To be determined during process of financial analysis at project startup

actual.comment: It is planned to be determined in the extension period.

indicator.title: Indicator 4
indicator.description: Total METT rating for PAs in relation to financial sustainability issues (criteria 1-4 and 24-31 – see ProDoc Annex 14 Section 2)

actual.comment: The updated METT value shows a value from 7.38/39 to 9.9/39. The indicators which showed improvement were those related to access and decision-making processes for existing communities and indigenous communities where applicable.

indicator.title: Indicator 5
indicator.description: Total rating for UNDP Financial Sustainability Scorecard

actual.comment: the results indicated an increase towards the goal of 30%, only for 7 of the 49 prioritized areas, these belong to the PA administrated by the Ministry.
